definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: Just recently, the station was also named the whole coal sample fine station.
sentences.chinese: 就在前不久，該站場還被評爲全煤樣板精品站場。

sentences.english: It was induced when shortly before the war I received a picture of my sweetheart.
sentences.chinese: 它被引起是在戰前不久，當時我收到一張女友的照片。

sentences.english: Not long ago, and Hunan have also carried out in cooperation of the entertainment category presentation ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 還有前不久還和湖南臺合作搞了個娛樂類的頒獎典禮。

sentences.english: She attempted such a strike just prior to the Corellian insurrection.
sentences.chinese: 就在科雷利亞叛亂前不久，她發動這樣一場進攻。

sentences.english: She has just completed a book about"New Media, Big Business"for the French publisher Fayard.
sentences.chinese: 前不久，她完成了一部名爲“新媒體，大生意”的書。

sentences.english: He's looking at the Jongs' pictures from their recent China trip.
sentences.chinese: 父親正在看一組龔家前不久去中國旅行拍得照片。

sentences.english: Later they found the car was stolen from a neighboring suburb earlier.
sentences.chinese: 隨後發現這部車是在這之前不久從附近的市郊偷來的。

sentences.english: During my recent inspection tour, I spoke of this wherever I went.
sentences.chinese: 我前不久出去，一路上都談這個問題。

sentences.english: I had gone to Senator Fulbright’s home to visit him not long before he died.
sentences.chinese: 富布賴特去世前不久，我曾去過他的家裏探望。

sentences.english: Not long ago, in a charming dream.
sentences.chinese: 前不久，於一個令人心醉的美夢。

definition: in the past few days/recently/in the last few days
late last year/the end of last year
the other day/a few days ago
not alone but in pairs (idiom, usually derog.); not a unique occurrence/it's not the only case
